body_html:
I lack a solution ATM since the graph visualizer basically defers to dagre-d3 for graph layout. dagre-d3 treats graph layout as an optimization problem that trades off speed vs a quality layout. See https://github.com/cpettitt/dagre/wiki#recommended-reading for specifics.

In this case, it is odd how the arrow from y-input to the overall scope node is curved (and not a beeline for the node). Maybe we're somehow compelling the arrow's head to land on the left side.

body:
I lack a solution ATM since the graph visualizer basically defers to dagre-d3 for graph layout. dagre-d3 treats graph layout as an optimization problem that trades off speed vs a quality layout. See https://github.com/cpettitt/dagre/wiki#recommended-reading for specifics.

In this case, it is odd how the arrow from y-input to the overall scope node is curved (and not a beeline for the node). Maybe we're somehow compelling the arrow's head to land on the left side.
